page.title: 08RIPLEY HOSPITAL
page.content: The hospital was built in 1928.Funds started for a hospital in Ripley after a miner died on his way to a hospital outside Ripley.Serious operations are sent to Derby Royal Infirmary.Minor operations are dealt with.People can stay at Ripley before and after their operations at Derby.Patients in the casualty department have fractured limbs and fractured skulls.They deal with home injuries e.g. scalds,burns and cuts.There are 25,000 visits to the out patients casualty ward and about 12,000 people who go to the casualty ward. At Ripley there is a physiotherapy department.People with broken limbs go there.At weekends people go to the hospital with sports injuries, mainly football, squash and cricket.The hospital does not often take children,it mostly takes elderly people.
